alert.note: Alert for McLean; Tazewell; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 31 at 3:24PM CDT until March 31 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR WOODFORD...NORTHEASTERN TAZEWELL AND NORTHWESTERN MCLEAN COUNTIES... At 323 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located near Eureka, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and two inch hail. SOURCE...At 3:21 PM CDT trained weather spotters confirmed a tornado south of Eureka. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... El Paso. This includes Interstate 39 between mile markers 10 and 28. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
